column4: I'm having some trouble with displaying fonts, they all appear as boxes. Can anyone help me out?
Hmm, it would seem your locals are set wrong. What language are you using? Where do you live? (US? Canada? (keep it vauge))
What fonts are giving you trouble? Did you modify any files under /etc?
How did you change it?
Never mind, I don't think that's a relevant file. I honestly don't know what it does Aha!
Can you put the output of the command "locale" on pastebin and sending me a link to it?
Open terminal, and type "locale" , hit enter. Go to http://www.pastebin.com and paste the output in the box, send me the link in the address bar.
Hit submit and send me the link* aha
http://pastebin.com/djgjWzmk
Okay... your locales are fine. That means its the fonts.
What fonts specifically are giving you problems? and where, in the terminal, on a tty, or in the desktop itself
Every program I open up seems to show these boxes as the font, but File Browser seems fine.
Did you change any fonts or anything like that?
the box fonts started appear after I tried installing GTK+ and necessary packages via Terminal.
I know, I'm making a command for you to try aha
Run this:  sudo apt-get install --reinstall --only-upgrade ttf*
Run this:  sudo apt-get install --reinstall --only-upgrade ttf-*
I received the following error after inputting your command: "E: Sense only is not understood, try true or false."
^.- Are you sure you put it exactly "sudo apt-get install --reinstall --upgrade-only ttf*"
^.- Are you sure you put it exactly "sudo apt-get install --reinstall --only-upgrade ttf*" <  sorry aha. Switched it a bit. This ones correct
I copied and pasted it into Terminal.
Try what I just typed once more, without quotes ""sudo apt-get install --reinstall --only-upgrade ttf*"
Still having the same problem
Damn... I really dont know.
